title: Facebook ad boycott gains steam as more brands jump ship: CNBC After Hours
text: CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos brings you the day's top business news headlines. On today's show, CNBC.com's Megan Graham explains the latest developments as more and more big corporations pull advertising spending from Facebook as the platform struggles to contain rampant hate speech and misinformation. Plus — CNBC's Ylan Mui dives deep into the police budgets in America's biggest cities.

title: Here's how big Facebook's ad business really is
text: Each day, more household names join the list of brands suspending advertising on Facebook to protest what they say are the social network's failures to stop the spread of hate. On Monday alone, Adidas, HP, and Ford added their names to a list that already had Unilever, The North Face, Coca Cola, Honda and many others.

title: Advertiser Exodus Snowballs as Facebook Struggles to Ease Concerns
text: The social network has tried striking a more conciliatory tone with its advertisers, who object to its handling of hate speech.

title: Here are the major brands that have pulled ads from Facebook
text: Since an advertising boycott of Facebook Inc. US:FB was organized in mid-June, a Who’s Who of major brands have either added their names to the #StopHateForProfit campaign or otherwise pulled their ads.

title: Facebook bans extremist 'boogaloo' group from its platforms
text: Although the term is not banned, the network has been designated as a dangerous organization similar to white supremacists

title: Target, Best Buy Join Over 350 Companies In Growing Facebook Boycott
text: Over 250 companies have announced a boycott of Facebook.

title: Facebook removes accounts associated with 'boogaloo' movement amid ads boycott
text: Facebook announced it removed a network of accounts, groups and pages associated with the far-right extremist movement known as "boogaloo."

title: Facebook’s Woes Could Get Worse: Survey Suggests More Advertisers May Bail From Social Media
text: Around 250 companies have announced they will no longer advertise with the tech giant—and a new survey suggests this is just the beginning.

title: The Real Source of Facebook Stock’s Long-Term Power Isn’t What You Think
text:
The long-term power for FB stock lies more in its cloud than in its apps, and its future lies more in services than in advertising.
The post The Real Source of Facebook Stock’s Long-Term Power Isn’t What You Think appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: With advertiser boycott growing, lawmakers press Facebook on white supremacy
text: In a new letter to Mark Zuckerberg, three Democratic lawmakers pressed the Facebook chief executive for accountability on his company’s role in amplifying white supremacy and allowing violent extremists, like those in “boogaloo” groups, to organize on its platform. Citing the “long-overdue” national reckoning around racial injustice, Senators Mazie Hirono (D-HI), Mark Warner (D-VA), and […]

title: 2016 Election Was 'Wake-Up Call' For Facebook Misuse
text: Major companies join boycott against Facebook on the grounds of civil rights.

title: Facebook has been allowed to become a 'cesspool': Walter Isaacson
text: Walter Isaacson, former CNN and Aspen Institute CEO, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss the growing boycott against Facebook's moderation policy.

title: 'They don't give a damn' — Cramer blasts Facebook, says do the right thing and stop hate speech
text: "Facebook has been trying to get away with this for a long time. This seems to be one of those moments where Big Corporate America is not going to take it anymore," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

title: Why Are Corporates Leaving Facebook, Twitter
text: Facebook shares are down as corporates distance themselves from social media giants.

title: Companies 'virtue signalling' over Facebook advertising boycott
text: Sir Martin Sorrell has accused some companies of "virtue signalling" as Facebook faces a growing advertising boycott over concerns that it is not doing enough to tackle hate speech.

title: Facebook executive says eliminating all hate speech is impossible
text: A high-powered Facebook executive has defended the company's response to hate speech, arguing that it is almost impossible to catch every case of it.

title: Third of advertisers may boycott Facebook in hate speech revolt
text: ‘Stop Hate for Profit’ campaign gathers momentum as ad boycott spreads outside US

title: Companies joining the Facebook ad boycott risk their bottom lines to take a stand
text: Facebook is a massively efficient channel for many businesses, and experts say cutting out the platform can be a major sacrifice, especially those that rely on it to bring in new customers. That makes joining the boycott a difficult question for some businesses.

title: More companies join Facebook boycott
text: Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi and Jared Blikre speak with Futurum Research Principal Analyst Daniel Newman about what the Facebook ad boycott means for the company’s revenue.

title: Democratic Senators Demand Facebook Answer For Its White Supremacist Problem
text: In a letter to Mark Zuckerberg, three Democratic senators question Facebook’s “lack of action” when it comes to the white supremacists on its platform.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy the Ad Boycott Dip in FB Stock
text:
This ad boycott against Facebook will be non-news by the fall, and so present weakness in FB stock is ephemeral. 
The post 3 Reasons to Buy the Ad Boycott Dip in FB Stock appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Can the Tech Giants Successfully Copy TikTok?
text: Facebook and Google are working on their own versions of the video app.

title: Facebook says it will prioritize original reporting and ‘transparent authorship’ in the News Feed
text: Facebook announced this morning that stories with original reporting will get a boost in the News Feed, while publications that don’t clearly credit their editorial staff will be demoted. The change comes as a number of high-profile companies have said that they will pull their advertising from Facebook as part of the #StopHateforProfit campaign, organized […]

title: Facebook agrees to audit its hate speech controls
text: Facebook Inc said on Monday it would submit itself to an audit of how it controls hate speech in a bid to appease a growing advertising boycott of the platform, as it prepared to address a group of advertisers on Tuesday.

title: Microsoft Reportedly Cuts Facebook/Instagram Advertising
text: Although not technically part of the Stop Hate for Profit "pause" campaign, Microsoft recently began to take its ad spending elsewhere.

title: Chobani, Pfizer and SAP join running list of companies pulling Facebook ads
text: Advertisers are continuing to join the "StopHateforProfit" campaign by vowing to stop spending money on Facebook ads in July to pressure the company to better prevent the spread of hate speech and misinformation.

title: #StopHateforProfit Strains Ad Revenues: 3 Stocks at Risk
text: #StopHateForProfit campaign is gaining steam with 180 advertisers having boycotted Facebook. Google and Twitter are undertaking initiatives to prevent themselves from facing the similar wrath.

title: Facebook cofounder Saverin’s B Capital just closed its third flagship fund with $822 million
text: It hasn’t taken long for B Capital to amass a pretty hefty third fund. Just five years after the venture firm was launched by Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin and Raj Ganguly, a veteran of private-equity firm Bain Capital, the firm is taking the wraps off a third fund that has amassed $822 million in capital […]

title: Facebook ad boycott: How big businesses 'hit pause on hate'
text: The "Stop Hate for Profit" campaign is gaining steam in a way that Facebook can't ignore.

title: Pepsi, Hershey and Starbucks Join Facebook (FB) Advertising Boycott – Cycles Turn Bearish
text: Today PepsiCo (PEP), Hershey (HSY), Starbucks (SBUX) and Clorox (CLX) joined the Facebook (FB) advertising boycott. This news comes after other major brands such as Unilever and Coca Cola (KO) also paused advertising on the company’s social media platforms.

title: Facebook boycott will have to be long term to bring about significant change, expert says
text: Paul Barrett, deputy director of the NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights, discusses big name brands' boycotting of Facebook.

title: Facebook's UK boss says 'when there's hate in the world there will also be hate on Facebook'
text: Patagonia, Ford, Adidas, HP, Coca-Cola, Unilever and Starbucks are just some of the companies that have joined the Stop Hate for Profit campaign.

title: Puma pauses ads on Facebook and Instagram in July
text: German sportswear brand Puma said on Tuesday it will pause all paid advertising globally on Facebook and Instagram throughout July to persuade the social media company to remove hostile and harmful conversation on its sites.

title: The Facebook ad boycott has to be indefinite to actually work
text:
Unilever, Diageo, Coca-Cola, Starbucks, and other marketers ditching the social network is great PR, but there needs to be more to have any real impact.
In the not-so immortal words of Supreme Leader Snoke, there has been an awakening—have you felt it?

title: Facebook is in the eye of the storm ahead of U.S. election: Martin Sorrell
text: Martin Sorrell, founder and executive chairman of S4 Capital, discusses digital advertising and big brands' decision to boycott Facebook.

title: Microsoft Paused Advertisement On Facebook, Instagram Globally, Expressing Concerns Over Inappropriate Content
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) in May paused all advertisements on Facebook Inc.

title: Facebook launches Avatars, its Bitmoji competitor, in India
text: Facebook Avatars, which lets users customize a virtual lookalike of themselves for use as stickers in chat and comments, is now available in India, the social juggernaut’s biggest market by users account. The American firm said Tuesday it had launched Avatars to India as more social interaction moves online amid a nationwide lockdown in the […]
